revised_title: James Kenner's Contributions to Chemistry and Stereochemistry
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of James Kenner, a prominent chemist who made significant contributions to the fields of organic chemistry and stereochemistry. Kenner's research focused on aromatic nitrocompounds, spiro-compounds, and the formation of compounds containing a seven-membered ring. His work on diphenyl derivatives and nitroso-compounds led to important discoveries in stereochemistry and the understanding of the structure of diphenyl and its derivatives.
